intro: Scorzonera glabra, commonly known as the naked scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers. The plant produces a taproot that is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Scorzonera glabra is part of the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
